alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 1:48PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from these thunderstorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area from these slow moving thunderstorms during the next couple of hours. If these rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for this area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Doral, Pinecrest, Sweetwater, West Miami, Kendale Lakes, Tamiami, West Kendall, University Park, The Crossings, Sunset, The Hammocks, Olympia Heights, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Westchester, Fountainbleau and Miccosukee Resort. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
